bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 100 (Thursday, May 28, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WALTZ:H.R. 7061.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, clause 2 and Article 1, Section 8,clause 18[Page H2359]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

Referred to the Committee on Natural Resources, and in addition to the Committees on Science, Space, and Technology, Small Business, the Judiciary, and Education and Labor, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: American Critical Mineral Exploration and Innovation Act of 2020

item.title: American Critical Mineral Exploration and Innovation Act of 2020
American Critical Mineral Exploration and Innovation Act of 2020

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: American Critical Mineral Exploration and Innovation Act of 2020
To promote the domestic exploration, research, development, and processing of critical minerals to ensure the economic and national security of the United States, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
